Finding scholarships for International Students in Thailand, fully funded for Masters and PhD (Doctoral) Courses, apply for Royal Thai Government Scholarships.

Through the Asian Institute of Technology (AIT), the Royal Thai Government Scholarship offers a number of non-binding doctoral and master’s level scholarships to deserving applicants from Thailand and other Asian nations who have achieved high academic standing. Students from all over Asia will be able to collaborate on research projects and study at AIT in a truly international setting thanks to the scholarships, laying the groundwork for greater cross-cultural understanding in Asia.

The winner can anticipate that the award will cover all of their housing, tuition, and living expenses. Students from Thailand and the rest of Asia are eligible for the opportunity. The scholarship is open to undergraduate and graduate students at AIT as well.

About 40 kilometers north of Bangkok, Thailand, is the international college known as the Asian Institute of Technology (AIT). Engineering, cutting-edge technologies, sustainable development, strategic management and planning, and sustainable development are the main areas of study. In 1959, it was established. It is ranked in the 200s in the QS World University Rankings by Subject 2024.

The goal of the Asian Institute of Technology is to teach students how to be leaders in the regional and global economies through sustainable development and global economic integration. Through teaching, study, and public engagement, the institute fosters technological advancement and environmentally responsible growth throughout the Asia-Pacific.

Summary of Scholarship

  • University or Organization: Asian Institute of Technology (AIT)
  • Course Level: Masters and PhD (Doctoral)
  • Award: Tuition fee
  • Access Mode: Online
  • Nationality: Domestic and International
  • The award can be taken in Thailand.
  • Application Deadline:  Applications will close on 28th February, 2024.

Eligibility

Candidates must satisfy all of the following to be eligible for Royal Thai Government Scholarships:

  • All international and Thai students from Asian countries are eligible to apply.
  • Subjects: The Asian Institute of Technology offers bachelor’s and master’s degree programs in the desired field of study for applicants to apply for.
  • Candidates must meet all of the following requirements in order to be considered:
      • A 4-year undergraduate degree and a 2-year master’s degree from an accredited institution in a related field are required of all applicants.
      • Candidates must have a 3.5 cumulative GPA for both their bachelor’s and master’s degrees.

How Can I Apply?

To apply for the Royal Thai Government Scholarship, please follow the following instructions:

  • To apply for admission, applicants must access the university’s application portal. All qualified candidates will be taken into consideration immediately.
  • Additional Documents: The students are required to submit a research proposal and letters of recommendation.
  • Conditions for entry: The applicants must meet the university’s entry requirements for international students.
  • Language: The scores of the following English language proficiency tests must be submitted by students:
  • IELTS – 6.0

Benefits

The recipient of a Royal Thai Government Scholarship will enjoy the following advantages:

The Royal Thai Government will provide the winners of this application with tuition, registration fees, housing, and a bursary to cover their living costs for seven semesters at AIT’s residential campus.
